election_record.label: Vermont 1819 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet of aggregate totals lists 12348 votes for Paul Brigham and 265 votes for James D. Butler.

The Vermont Republican and American Yeoman (Windsor, VT), The Christian Messenger (Middlebury, VT), The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), October 19, The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT), The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT) and The Rutland Vermont Herald (Rutland, VT) report 12348 votes for Paul Brigham and 265 votes for James D. Butler.
The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT) refers to James D. Butler as R.D. Butler.

sub_unit.name: Monkton
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet has a note stating that the votes from Monkton were "objected."

sub_unit.name: Caledonia
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists 1052 votes for Paul Brigham in Caledonia County.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists 681 votes for Paul Brigham in Franklin County.

sub_unit.name: Grand Isle
sub_unit.note: The aggregate totals in the original returns list no scattering votes in Grand Isle County.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns aggregate votes tally sheet lists 63 votes for James D. Butler in Washington County; however, the tally sheet for Washington County lists 62 votes.

sub_unit.name: Athens
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet has a note stating that the votes from Brookline were included in the total for Athens.

sub_unit.name: Townshend
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet has a note stating that the votes from Acton were included in the total for Townshend.

sub_unit.name: Windham
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet has a note stating that in Windham there were "no votes returned."

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists 2225 votes for Paul Brigham and 157 scattering votes in Windsor County.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Vermont State Archives, Middlesex.
Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT). October 25, 1819.
Vermont Republican and American Yeoman (Windsor, VT). October 25, 1819.
Fairbanks, Edward Taylor. The Town of St. Johnsbury VT: a review of one hundred and twenty-five years to the anniversary pageant 1912. St. Johnsbury, VT: The Cowles Press, 1914. 571.
